intro: Panke tinctoria, commonly known as the red root or redroot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the northeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant is notable for its deep red roots, which have been historically used for dyeing fabrics and as a medicinal herb. Its leaves are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. Panke tinctoria thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland habitats.
